Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2009 07:39PM - edited Apr 3, 2009 07:43PM by 31andscared Amiekae, You're Not Alone. I was diagnosed last August - same age as you.  I had double mastectomy followed with chemo.  I also have two little boys - 4 and 2yrs old.  The scariest of times is in the beginning.  Once you start your journey of surgery and chemotherapy, you'll realize that you truly are able to take every day as it comes.  You'll get through this...and will come out as a survivor.  Breast cancer truly makes us young girls have to grow up quickly, but you'll be amazed at how strong you are throughout it all. Lean on your support people to help get you through, and always be able to ask for help when you need it.  Cry when you need to, but also laugh as often as you can.  Relish in your kids' love.  My kids' love was very healing to me throughout treatment Stay strong dear...you will beat this beast!
Posts.Title: 31 and just diagnosed amiekae Jodi_Smart

Posts.Content: Sep 15, 2008 05:24PM 31andscared wrote: If it gives you any comfort...I'm in exactly the same shoes as yours.  DCIS - high-grade (there is a microinvasion in the biopsy).  I am needing a mastectomy due to calcifications consuming 80% of the breast.  I am opting to have a double mastectomy.  I have too many years ahead of me to worry if the cancer will return.  You sound like you're right on track, and that you're really doing your homework on all of this.  I'm sure you'll come out the other side with flying colors!
Posts.Title: Need Advice and Support SybilLaird gemsa

Posts.Content: 31andscared wrote: I am scared out of my mind about my new diagnosis of breast cancer.  I have high-grade DCIS and am facing a double mastectomy at the age of 31.  I am told there may be more invasive cancer in a finding from the biopsy called a microinvasion.  Does anyone know more about microinvasion?  I'm terrified.  I need fellow cancer-fighting warriors to share their strength and coping methods.  I need any support I can get! Dx 8/20/2008, IDC, <1cm, Stage I, Grade 2, 0/3 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
